components.name: Markdown Source Repository
components.description: Central Git repository containing all threat modeling documentation in Markdown format.

components.name: Static Site Generator
components.description: Build tool (e.g., MkDocs or Hugo) that converts Markdown into a static website.

components.name: CI/CD Pipeline
components.description: Automated workflow (e.g., GitHub Actions) that triggers builds, runs tests, and deploys the site.

components.name: Hosting Service
components.description: Public web host (e.g., GitHub Pages, Netlify) that serves the generated static site to end users.

data_flows.description: Source files are pulled by the generator to produce HTML/CSS assets.
Generated site files are uploaded to the hosting platform.
Pipeline deploys the built site to the host.

trust_boundaries.name: Source Code Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: Separates internal developers from external contributors; controls who can modify threat modeling documents.

trust_boundaries.name: Build Environment Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: Separates the CI/CD runner from the source repository; ensures builds are performed in a clean, isolated environment.

trust_boundaries.name: Deployment Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: Separates the internal build artifacts from the public-facing hosting platform; controls what is exposed to end users.
